intro: Xylanthemum gilletii, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, which bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Xylanthemum gilletii is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
